intro: Pimpinella polyclada, commonly known as the clustered cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are compound, with a distinctive pinnate structure, and the plant often grows in shaded, moist environments. Pimpinella polyclada is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
